title: Dan Dan Noodles
description: A classic Sichuan street-food dish of chewy wheat noodles tossed in a savory, spicy sesame-chili sauce with ground pork and crunchy preserved vegetables. Bold flavors come from toasted sesame, Sichuan peppercorn aroma, and a bright vinegar finish — quick to assemble on weeknights.

ingredients.display_name: fresh or dried wheat noodles (e.g., Chinese wheat/ramen style)
ingredients.notes: use fresh alkaline or dried wheat noodles; adjust cook time per package
can substitute ground chicken or turkey

ingredients.display_name: toasted sesame paste (tahini or Chinese sesame paste)
ingredients.notes: use smooth paste; can thin with stock if needed
use low-sodium stock to control salt

ingredients.display_name: sichuan peppercorns, toasted and lightly ground
pickled mustard greens (zha cai or preserved mustard), finely chopped
ingredients.notes: optional but traditional for texture and tang
for browning pork and blooming aromatics
use to thicken sauce if desired

steps.text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil; cook noodles according to package instructions until al dente, then drain and toss with a small drizzle of oil to prevent sticking.
While the water heats, combine sesame paste, soy sauce, chili oil, rice vinegar, sugar, and warm chicken stock in a mixing bowl; whisk until smooth and set the sauce aside.
Heat neutral oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat; add the white parts of the scallions, minced garlic and ginger and stir-fry briefly until fragrant (about 30–45 seconds).
Add ground pork to the pan; break up with a spatula and cook until browned and crisp in places, about 6–8 minutes; season lightly with a pinch of salt and half the ground Sichuan peppercorns.
If using pickled mustard greens, stir them into the cooked pork and cook 1–2 minutes to warm through and meld flavors.

Taste the reserved sesame-chili sauce and adjust seasoning with more soy, vinegar, or chili oil as preferred; if the sauce is very thick, whisk in a little hot stock or cooking water to reach a coating consistency.
Divide warm noodles among bowls; spoon the sesame-chili sauce over the noodles, then top with a generous portion of the cooked ground pork and pickled vegetable mixture.

Garnish each bowl with sliced scallion greens, toasted sesame seeds, chopped peanuts, remaining toasted ground Sichuan peppercorn, and optional soft-boiled egg; toss before eating to coat noodles in sauce.
